intro: Parnassia alpina, commonly known as the alpine parnassia, is a flowering plant native to alpine regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its striking white, cup-shaped flowers with a central yellow spot. The plant typically grows in rocky or moist, acidic soils at high elevations. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Parnassia alpina is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
